website_summaries.verdict: Like most topical treatments, results can be mixed, but Advantix works very well at repelling both ticks and fleas for one month per dose.
pros: Many owners report the product works well and lasts into the fourth week after application
Does a great job of repelling ticks, and discourages fleas as well
cons: Treatment, like others, doesn’t always last the full month
Some sensitivity and a few adverse reactions in dogs reported by owners
Doesn’t work at all for some

customer_reviews.title: I applied the treatment to my 11 year old dog ...
customer_reviews.text: I applied the treatment to my 11 year old dog in the afternoon that night she had explosive diarrhea. It continued all the next day/night and now she has been thowing up. We have used flea and tick treatment all her life but not this brand. I don't know why all the sudden this is an issue now or what is in this product that is making her so ill. It's a shame because now I have a six month supply but I can't use because it made her so sick I would never put her through this again.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: The best flea and tick drops on the market bar none
customer_reviews.text: The best flea and tick drops on the market bar none. I've tried them all including those 8 month collars that are a waste of money. I have 3 large dogs and live in a sub tropical climate where fleas thrive. Since I have started using K9 Advantix not one of my dogs has ever had a flea. Most of the other products on the market eventually fail. Take it from a real person with real dogs not a fake, paid reviewer.
customer_reviews.author: Epicus Doomicus

customer_reviews.title: POISON... if you love your dog....NOOOOO!
customer_reviews.text: Do not use this, please! Just had to sit with my dog having SEIZURES in the tub, washing her with dish soap to break the oils down. Developed ear twitches within hours of putting this on her, then stumbling, then foggy eyes and depression....then seizures. Within MINUTES of washing this off... she was wagging and happy again. Stop putting poison on your animals. I just ordered essential oils and brewers yeast to use instead. Please research this. I never write reviews because I figure to each their own, but this POISONED my dog. No, I'm not crazy, I have a doctorate, I'm not stupid, please feel free to contact me with questions. keep your fur babies SAFE!!!!
customer_reviews.author: C Jacobi

customer_reviews.title: Stay away. 80lb Dog broke out in hives within 20 mintues and Hives everyday since applying. She's
customer_reviews.text: 20 minutes after applying on my 80lb dog she broke out in hives. The hives will only go away by treating with benadryll. 5 days have gone by and every morning the poor dog is covered in hives again and is more miserable than with the fleas. I have to treat her with benadryll every day. I don't know how long she will continue to have a reaction to this drug but 5 days is enough. Please just bathe your dog in natural flee removal shampoo and peppermint spray. Dry skin from washing too little often is far better than her having big hives all over every morning. Poor pup has them on her face and she's so itchy.
customer_reviews.author: J. Doug

customer_reviews.title: I am so disappointed in Bauer and Amazon
customer_reviews.text: I am so disappointed in Bauer and Amazon. This product made my 1.5 year old 70 pound golden retriever extremely sick. I used as directed where he could not ingest any of it but over the past 12 hours (beginning the morning after I gave it to him) he is constantly having really bad diarrhea and vomiting every few hours. We have him this medicine to bring him on a lake vacation where he would be in the tall grass and exposed to ticks and it has made him so sick! I've washed it off of his back and hopefully he starts to get better otherwise we will be visiting an out of town vet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Has always worked great for my dog
customer_reviews.text: I've used this for years and it works great. Our region has started having tick problems over the past couple of years yet we never find a live tick on our dog. We used prescription flea and tick meds for awhile, which was incredibly expensive. This is much more economical and every bit as effective. I do know of a dog that seemed to be sensitive to this when it was applied and reacted like he was being burned, so I suggest ordering the minimum amount at first so you know your dog will tolerate it.
customer_reviews.author: Chinacat

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money, this stuff doesn’t work
customer_reviews.text: I treated my dog with this product because I didn’t have time to take her to the vet for the tablet I normally use (comfortus) she didn’t have fleas but we are avid hikers so I knew she would be exposed. I used this on the day I’d normally give the monthly dose of comfortus and in less than two weeks she was infected with fleas. I treated her again, and treated/cleaned my home; I’m fairly certain it did not work at all. The fleas are all over her despite two treatments in less than a month on top of an obsessive treatment/cleaning of the house. I’ll never buy this again. It does not work. Don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: willa monday

customer_reviews.title: Best for Mosquitoes
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding product. I don't know where we would be without it. My dogs can run freely offer the leash but go into heavily wooded areas that are tick and flea and mosquito infested. This medication provides a monthly barrier against these threats. Although my two boys scratch at the site for the first few days, the discomfort is acceptable compared to the alternative......tick infestation!!!!!! If your dog ever brought home a tick nest.....I don't have to tell you anymore. If not, don't use hindsight, get Advantix II.
customer_reviews.author: Prime 101

customer_reviews.title: Full fledged Conservative, Parasite free Dog!!
customer_reviews.text: Unlike the Liberal agenda, there are no parasites living off my dog for free. If only we could line our borders with Advantix! Perhaps we could encase Democratic Legislation and Policy with Advantix to get all the freeloader things to fall off. Ahhh, in a perfect world. For now, my pup is happily supporting himself with the help of Bayer Advantix!
customer_reviews.author: andrea

customer_reviews.title: ALMOST KILLED MY DOG
customer_reviews.text: This product is NOT safe! Do not buy this. I have a 2 year old belgian malinois and he began having seizures after using this product. It took us months to figure out that it was the K9 Advantix causing the problems. I have videos of the horrible things it did to my dog and I have so much money in vet bills just trouble shooting the issue. This is not safe i can't believe they are even allowed to sell this product. I have had good luck with seresto collars for anyone searching for safe flea and tick solutions
customer_reviews.author: Codeman

customer_reviews.title: Best stuff!
customer_reviews.text: This works far better than other flea products. It will kill adult fleas and even if you think it isn't working, it is. I've been critical of Advantix because the past 2 years have been crazy fleas around here. I've found out this summer that I'm far better off to use this product than not. I also do my yard, my house, my cats etc with other flea products. So this year I tried using something else on my dogs. What a nightmare! I bought more of this recently and it's made a huge difference. I still have to do around the house etc but my dog is so much happier.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Nagel

customer_reviews.title: This is the go to product! Dont buy anything else until you read!
customer_reviews.text: I had a crazy flea infestation this year! Its been years since Ive had to deal with this so naturally I ran straight to plus which seemed to do absolutely nothing. Next I read reviews and thought I should try this and it worked amazingly on both my dog and cats! About 2 weeks after using it they stopped itching and looked grear! 3 weeks later I havent been able to find any fleas!!! Will never go back to Frontline and I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Sara Gochanour

customer_reviews.title: Not What It Used To Be
customer_reviews.text: We have a 80-lb Weimeraner mix. This has been our go-to flea and tick medicine for the last few years since moving to an area with tons of ticks and mosquitoes. I don't know what changed but it's not doing the job anymore. I'm pulling multiple fleas off her each day, she's itching like crazy, and I find at least 3 ticks a week on her. And that started after only 10 days. That didn't used to be the case- it always worked well which is why we have stuck with it these few years. Now we'll need to try a new brand because this just isn't getting the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Kay

customer_reviews.title: Immediate Reaction
customer_reviews.text: This was the first time I've used Advantix on my pitbull. Within and hour of applying it, she developed a twitching in her ears. She seemed to keep pawing at them. After a call to the vet we learned it is a fairly common side effect of the meds. One option is to use a dosage for a smaller dog but, I'm not sure I want to take the chance of another 2 - 3 weeks of twitching.
customer_reviews.author: M.

customer_reviews.title: Not sure if it was the product or the season!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used this product before and it did what it was supposed to. But not this time, we had to take a trip to the vet and get something stronger. She did mention this season has been harder to control the fleas. We’ve treated our yard, washed all the blankets, beds, towels, vacuumed and it just didn’t work. It made it better but didn’t get rid of them.
customer_reviews.author: Mitzy Benitez

customer_reviews.title: Worked well for my dog!
customer_reviews.text: This flea medicine helped get rid of the itching that my dog had when we first got him and now he only has the occassional itch. I liked buying this via Amazon because it was cheaper than at our military veterinarian. Just a reminder not to use this on cats as it is toxic for them!
customer_reviews.author: Summer

customer_reviews.title: The absolute BEST in pest protection for your dogs
customer_reviews.text: K9 Advantix II is the only flea/tick/mosquito/fly treatment that protects my Newfie from pests. I recently made the stupid mistake of trying another brand and I'm kicking myself. If you haven't used this yet, you really need to try it--especially if you live in one of the mosquito capitals of the universe, as I do (Maine, where the mosquitoes are not only larger and meaner than anywhere else, but smarter--in fact, they're smarter than most of my neighbors). When you combine heavy pest problems with a long-haired dog (especially one with sensitive skin, like my Newfie), you want the best. K9 Advantix II IS the best. Trust me.
customer_reviews.author: Literary Elf

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: I have been fighting a flea infestation since last spring in NC when the Seresto Collars stopped working for them. I have gone through 5 different dips and this is the first one that my dog has seen any relief with. It has been 2 weeks since her first treatment and I have pulled off 2 fleas. Otherwise, she is flea-free! I am also using a home treatment spay at my home and office and using Wondercide on our yard. So far so good with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Lphickey26

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for us with no side effects.
customer_reviews.text: Worked overnight on a bad infestation. Given some of the negative reviews I had real reservations about using this on my dogs. I applied it on the first dog and the next day when I combed her I didn't find a single live flea. The next day my second dog and the one I was most worried about due to his allergies got his dose. There we no adverse reactions and 24 hours later he too was free of fleas. Before trying this we tried the 'natural' remedies. They DO work but only for a few hours while the dog's coats were still wet or damp with the oils.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Canha

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work, drawbacks though
customer_reviews.text: Our dogs have been on this for at least two years and they get no nasty critters, so it works. I dock it a star because of the application method. You have to avoid touching your dogs back for like, 2 days every month. If this came in a pill at this price point it would be a far superior product, but alas, the oral ones tend to cost far more . . . . .
customer_reviews.author: Mlkcrawford

customer_reviews.title: Not working
customer_reviews.text: I have used this product for several years on my dogs so I bought a six month supply... for some reason it is not working both dogs have had several ticks on them... and they continued to get more ticks on them. I called the company and it was no help. I will not buy this ever again, although I am stuck with 5 more months for both dogs. Very disappointed in the product. I did contact Prime and they will let me return the product which is what I am going to do.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poison
customer_reviews.text: This stuff needs to be banned. My baby is healthy and only 3. This is the side effect!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works 100% if you don't use grub killer on your lawn
customer_reviews.text: Have used Advantix since the 1990s and have never seen a flea or tick on any of my various 100 lb Old English Sheepdogs. The key for effectiveness is to be sure you don't use grub killer on the lawn where your dogs often play, including city parks and neighbors' lawns. The reason: grub killer has the same core ingredient as Advantix, and insects will adapt to living in a grub killer environment in the grass, so that the fleas won't die, either in the lawn or on your dog. Keep your lawn free of pesticides and this stuff is 100% effective.
customer_reviews.author: Bart Hugens

customer_reviews.title: Under 12# dogs BEWARE, Over 12# Ok
customer_reviews.text: TAIL OF TWO EXPERIENCES. FIRST: My two 15-20# dogs did very well. Fleas seem to be under control. Easy to apply. Left no residue or greasy fur behind after dried. SECOND: My 7.5# poodle had a bad reaction. It made him react like his skin was crawling. Ran around, scratched, cried and rolled. It was very sad and scary. We gave him a bath to wash what we could off and dosed him with benadryl. Helped reduce symptoms. He is back to normal 48hrs. I will use it again on my bigger dogs. I WOULD NOT USE IT ON DOGS UNDER 12#s
customer_reviews.author: HIGH TIDE

customer_reviews.title: Sad
customer_reviews.text: We had used K9 Advantix for years and years. Since we got our pomeranian back in 2006 and it had always worked beautifully. We never had a problem with fleas, ticks or mosquitos on our dogs and we live in the south! Something has changed though because the last 2-3 years even with the Advantix we have had problems with fleas off and on a few times. So sad and disappointed our go-to protection is no longer effective.
customer_reviews.author: Heaven Leigh

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT KILL FLEAS
customer_reviews.text: Horrible Product, I tried for two months with K9 advantix hoping the fleas would die off of my two dogs. The product doesn't work at all with the fleas in California. A week after my dogs second application, they were still riddled with fleas. They only give you a month to decide if you want to return/if it works. While I was trying to give it some time to work (2 months), the product doesn't at all meet my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren R.

customer_reviews.title: Thoroughly disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I have given this product the benefit of the doubt. It's horrible. After 4 doses for my dog, he's still scratching like crazy, and I can literally see the fleas on him. I received this on August 14th. I used as directed. It even said during the first month until they get the medicine in their system, it may take a couple to few doses, then once a month thereafter. I did exactly that. No go....terrible. I have always used Frrontline plus, but it seemed to be weakening, so I thought I'd try this. What a waste of money. I will return to Frontline, and hope it has much better results.
customer_reviews.author: RiPeJerDen

customer_reviews.title: What a disappointment!
customer_reviews.text: I really had high hopes for this product, but my 120 lb Lab was constantly being bitten by ticks. We pulled ticks that were engorged with blood off of him, we found massively swollen ticks on the floor, we found ticks on his bed. And they were all still alive. I have already ordered Frontline, which has always worked well. If we found a tick, it was dead.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Week later - 1/2 as many fleas..
customer_reviews.text: Followed the instructions. Bought 6 monthly doses because I have 3 boxers 2 boys 1 year old and a 2yo girl....A week later, my teenager complained she had bites while watching TV with one of the dogs.. We looked at the dogs, in the groin and sure enough there were fleas scurrying. If it doesn't work in a week, It won't work for a month.. I still have 3 packets left. I am demanding my money back..My buddy told me only thing working is oral stuff from Vet.. and Vet is too expensive for me. I am retired.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence Macionski

customer_reviews.title: Arrived missing half a dose. Or, one of two.
customer_reviews.text: The actual product is fine and keeps my dog protected from fleas ticks and mosquitos no problem, and the application was ok. However, it arrived with only one dose (out of two) and open. So... how do I correct this or return it? How would I prove it? Who would do this? It would also take time to return it when I actually need to apply it before a trip, thus requiring me to go to another physical store to pick some up in the meantime. I would encourage people to just get this in a real store or at the Vets office.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Caused sickness and burns
customer_reviews.text: This made all 3 of my dogs puke for 24 hrs. My lab, my dachshund, and Pomeranian-chihuahua. All three were given correct doses. My dachshund actually had this burn her skin and she had an open wound in between her shoulder blades. Not only did this cause illness for my dog-family, my dogs flea issue was not treated. Due to the sickness, I would NOT recommend for your pup-family.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsie

customer_reviews.title: very effective protection
customer_reviews.text: I love this product! I own three or four large dogs at any time, live in the country and have used this product for several years. I have never seen a flea or tick on any of my dogs. They are not bothered by mosquitoes or even flies and other pesky bugs, though the product makes no claim for flies and other bugs. My babies have never contracted heartworm, tapeworm or diseases carried by insects. Totally satisfied. I just wish they made it for people!
customer_reviews.author: dparson

customer_reviews.title: Product is not working
customer_reviews.text: I'm not happy about this purchase at all. At one point Bayer made quality products. Perhaps it was old or stored improperly. I live in southeastern USA. There are three things you can count on: humidity, mosquitoes, and fleas. I have kept my pup on a three week schedule for flea prevention. Now she is being eaten alive and when they get tired of munching on her they hop on me. I have used 3 doses with baths in between and the flea population is rampant. This is horrible as I'm on a fixed income and will have to wait till next month to find an alternative.
customer_reviews.author: Robin M.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: I bought this until I get a refill on our Revolution and I am now reminded why I don't use OTC flea/tick meds. Both of my dogs itch non-stop and I found a tick and fleas on my Boxer. We have tried bathing them before and after applying this each month to see which works better and it doesn't matter. They scratch and bite all the time. I only gave it 2 stars because it didn't break them out and they didn't become infested, but I will not buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Walker

customer_reviews.title: Horrible !  Rash, Hair LOSS -
customer_reviews.text: Permethrin toxicity is what i was told after 2 months of use - Advantix refused a refund after several phone calls- I would stay away and save your money - Do your homework, we switched to the Seresto collars and no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Did they change the formula
customer_reviews.text: I've used it before with great results. We only tend to get fleas around here in the late summer so I don't keep it on my pup year round, bathed him and when dry added his drops and here we are a week later with even more fleas than we had before the drops. Idk what the deal is.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Maynard

customer_reviews.title: Dont work
customer_reviews.text: I got these at a good price but they dont seem to be working for my dog because hes still itching like crazy so I guess you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: andrew mccorkle

customer_reviews.title: Not the biggest fan of the company
customer_reviews.text: Manufacturer has questionable business practies, but this is a great product and has no adverse effects on my dogs. Gets the job done. I like the easy of applying it vs. its competitor products. It seems as if there is more liquid in here than competitors, so I have to use a lot of space on pups. But they never itch or do the classic back scratch on the floor/carpet after applying.
customer_reviews.author: JustAGuy

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT PURCHASE...Vials do not have full amount of product (4 ml) in them
customer_reviews.text: For years I have ordered K9 Advantix II in the extra large dog size. I have 3 different size dogs so I use a 3ml syringe and apply the correct amount for each size dog. With this purchase I realized there is only 2 to 2.5 ML in each vial. They are clearly marked 4.0 ml. Something is not right, the packing all looks legitimate and is sealed but something is clearly not on the up and up. I would not purchase this. It is strange because this order does not show in my purchase history either and I just bought it. I will be contacting Amazon to see what can be done.
customer_reviews.author: pam Hull

customer_reviews.title: Jake, my German Shepherd approves
customer_reviews.text: Some fleas moved in with a neighbors dog at some point and Jake decided to import some to my apartment. The poor guy was miserable - scratching, chewing on himself, tearing out fur - you name it. He even chewed a hole in his back overnight one night. After an application of this the next day the chewing and scratching had stopped. Within a few days his sore closed up and his fur started growing back in. He's a much happier dog when I use this stuff. It's not cheap, but he's worth it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Morse

customer_reviews.title: Completely Ineffective Waste of Money
customer_reviews.text: About 3 weeks ago we noticed a couple of ticks on our dog (not surprising since it's getting warmer outside) and immediately ordered this product. It arrived and we applied. A week later, more ticks. Applied another doses thinking it might not have been enough due to the weight of our dog. He is now covered in ticks. This product is worthless. I don't know if we got a bad batch or if it was just expired, but it didn't work at all.
customer_reviews.author: MoCa425

customer_reviews.title: Protection for dogs from ticks and fleas
customer_reviews.text: We bought this brand hoping our dog would be protected, as we do have ticks in our area. She stays in a dog run with gravel, attached to our house, and once in a while I was taking her for a walk out in the pasture area. I found one tick in her ear so far, about 1 week later. She dosen't seem to be bothered by any fleas, but I am not sure how to comment on that tick I found in her ear. Will be checking her more, to see if it really works.
customer_reviews.author: My Bar 20 Ranch

customer_reviews.title: Did nothing to the fleas, just made my dog sick
customer_reviews.text: This did not work on my dog at all, just made him worse and sick. With the first dose he was vomiting and had diarrhea but just for a few days after giving him the product. After a few days I checked him and he still had fleas. I waited until the next month to give him another dose thinking maybe it would be effective after two doses but nope. He got sick again and lost appetite after the second dose and his skin is dried out and flakey and he has just as many fleas as before I tried the product. Complete waist of money.
customer_reviews.author: Dani

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS!!!
customer_reviews.text: DOG LOVERS AND OWNERS BEWARE!!! 10 hours after applying this to our senior yellow lab, she began having tremors!! We could tell something was off with her all morning and then her shoulders starting shaking and the tremors began! DO NOT BUY THIS!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kymber S.

customer_reviews.title: Works well on our fenced in city pups!
customer_reviews.text: This product works well on our dogs. It’s a good value. It’s cheaper for us to order them on amazon than it is for us to purchase at our local vets. The vet office will tell you to be careful about ordering product because of expiration dates, but that has never been an issue. I believe they just say that to get you to purchase from them. When we use this product we do not see any fleas.
customer_reviews.author: debi

customer_reviews.title: You’ll be pleased when you find dead ticks on your dog.
customer_reviews.text: My 3 year old Belgium Malinois came down with Lyme Disease last summer, though we didn’t know about it until October. She had a severe case of it. This year rather than taking any chances I decided to use K9 Advantix II on the whole pack of 3 dogs. I’m not a fan of chemicals by any means but I’ve got to say we were very happy to pull a few dead ticks off two of the dogs, and found a dead tick on the carpet. We are in the second month of application. None of our dogs got sick from the Advantix II. I think you can trust this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Henwhisperer

customer_reviews.title: Used to work but not this time.
customer_reviews.text: I have had good luck with this in the past and never saw fleas or ticks. This week I pulled a tick of both of my dogs. Very disappointed as this is supposed to repell ticks, amd both were firmly attached! The application was put in about 2 weeks prior. I won't order this again.
customer_reviews.author: marie

customer_reviews.title: Ineffective in Louisiana
customer_reviews.text: I switched to Advantix after PetArmor failed to clear the fleas on my husky-mix. Fleas are rampant in the area so I was hopeful that Advantix would be more effective. I didn't really notice a difference after switching to Advantix. After a few months I talked to my vet who put my dog on NexGard which worked like a charm. Maybe Advantix works better in other parts of the country (I assume it has to work somewhere if it's so well reviewed) - but I think topical preventatives just aren't effective in Louisiana.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Good for flies
customer_reviews.text: Still doesn’t keep off all of the ticks, but I’m not sure anything does with outside dogs. But we have seen a significant reduction in the amount of horseflies that attack their ears and tails since we switched over to this instead of Frontline
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bayer K9 Advantix II Flea, Tick and Mosquito Prevention: not recommendedd
customer_reviews.text: We used the version for extra large dogs over 55 lbs. for our two. This product worked well but only for about 2 weeks, not the 4 weeks it claims. The dogs tolerated it without any problems. It was easy to apply. It bothered me that after 2 weeks the dogs either needed another application or they had fleas for 2 weeks. I didn't like applying it to them that often. We are going to look for another flea treatment for them.
customer_reviews.author: missing mish

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: You take the cover off, click out onto the tube, and you have an easy to use product. It smells. Your dog may not appreciate the stink, but once it has been absorbed it seems to work. Random other bugs may march across your dog, but none will burrow and stay. Did have something bite my pup despite the stinkiness of it. Applied triple antibiotic cream to it to avoid a reaction to the bite.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: so good, 6 months of using this and no issues
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good, 6 months of using this and no issues, I just put it on them at 7pm and when we wake up in the morning, I do all my bedding to get rid of trace amounts, because we have cats and this can be toxic to them within 24 hours of the application, It is better then the pills I was giving them, they would throw up all over the place or have the runs after taking them. Plus those pills have soy and we are deadly allergic to soy.
customer_reviews.author: Ddaeng

customer_reviews.title: This medicine is FATAL to cats
customer_reviews.text: The active ingredient in this, permethrin, is FATAL to cats. If you read the fine print on this, it says you cannot have your dog around a cat for 24 hours after application. Our cat laid next to our dog after using this and ended up in the hospital with severe muscle tremors leading to seizures. This type of poisoning is often fatal to cats. Fortunately for our cat, after 36 hours of IV fluids and seizure medicine, he recovered. Very surprised they don’t have better labeling on this saying how dangerous it is. The box just says don’t use on cats. Not enough!
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Wursche

customer_reviews.title: May have a bad reaction.
customer_reviews.text: Applied this to my 2 year old 90 pound shepherd per instructions. He slept for 6 hours and we could barely arouse him. Called vet and he said that this reaction was not uncommon and to give the dog overnight to “come out of it”. Luckily, he did but, needless to say, we won’t use this product anymore on him. Wish I could get a refund but it was not offered.
customer_reviews.author: marymarin

customer_reviews.title: Advantix II works.
customer_reviews.text: The box Bayer provides for this flea, etc. med is truly flimsy, no heavier than cardstock. During shipping, it ruptured which meant that the contents--six foil-enclosed vials of the topical insecticide--spilled out into the external shipping container, rattling around along side multiple bags containing treats for my dogs. I felt that contamination of the food products was a possibility; a thorough examination of the foil envelopes relieved my concern, fortunately. I believe it is essential to enclose the Advantix II in external impenetrable and waterproof packaging!
customer_reviews.author: LLJTBB

customer_reviews.title: Less Than 1 Week After Application And I See Ticks
customer_reviews.text: I put this on my Irish Wolfhound on May 23rd. On May 27th., I found an engourged tick. On May 28th., I found another one, and today, May 29th., I found another one. I bought the appropriate size for my dog's weight and followed the directions precisely but she still has ticks.
customer_reviews.author: Inspector Morse

customer_reviews.title: This stuff is nasty and doesn't work.
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is nasty and doesn't work. We have a large dog (100 pounds). This product raised large crusty patches on his skin. That would have been mildly acceptable if it worked; but it didn't. Within two weeks of application he was infested with fleas. Even worst our whole house was also infested. Finally took him to our vet. The vet chided us for using the product saying it was "poison" . After a flea treatment by the vet, our dog is now flea-free. We are still working on ridding our house of the creatures..
customer_reviews.author: Erwin Ruhland

customer_reviews.title: Ripoff!
customer_reviews.text: This product came already opened and one of the medication tubes was missing- I paid for 6 but only got 5. This is an expensive flea med. I wont be buying from Bayer again. Not happy!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Theresa

customer_reviews.title: I cannot recommend this product for large dogs
customer_reviews.text: We have applied this to our 100 lb Lab and 62 lb Australian Shepard, but we continue to pull "live" ticks off them. We apply the 22-50 lb dose to our 35 lb beagle and it appears to work....we constantly pull ticks off her, but they are dead. I think the "over 55#" might not be effective for dogs much heavier than that...and I am not sure it is safe to give a "double dose". Of course, that would be extremely expensive, too. So, unfortunately, we must explore new options for relief for the two larger dogs. I cannot recommend this product for large dogs.
customer_reviews.author: The Vee

customer_reviews.title: So we keep giving him a bath until we can retreat him next month with a product that is not bad like this one obviously was
customer_reviews.text: Used this product on our two dogs and they still have fleas. The one dog does not see to be itching as much but my other dog is still suffering. I keep seeing fleas on him he has licked his paw raw where he must be getting bit. So we keep giving him a bath until we can retreat him next month with a product that is not bad like this one obviously was. Amazon should not be allowing the sale of poor products they need someone to help with quality control!! This product did not work like the original you buy at the vet or in the store of the same exact product. now why is that?
customer_reviews.author: ME53

customer_reviews.title: Quickest and best way to get rid of fleas and ticks
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had German Shepherds for over 65 years and this the only product I’ve ever used that works so fast and completely! It’s easy to apply and if there is a problem with fleas or ticks, they are all dead within 2 hours, even in Florida wher those nasty critters live year around. It’s also safer for the dogs and cats hen some of the monthly chews out there.
customer_reviews.author: Gene McCullough

customer_reviews.title: Best by far
customer_reviews.text: Best by far, tried nearly all other brands, used one brand for a couple years bought at Walmart, it stopped working effectively, tried this and the three ticks feeding dropped off in hours after applying, I will stay with this brand until it, if it does continue working it is for my Little Girl a medium German Shepard Pitbull mix, she's a kisser and never a biter, not a beast within her, she diserves the best
customer_reviews.author: Raggedy

customer_reviews.title: Keeps the ticks away but leaves a greasy residue on fur
customer_reviews.text: This stuff works well at keeping ticks away, and ultimately that is what matters most for keeping Fido safe. It is quite expensive for what it is though, Also after applying it, the dog has a greasy strip of fur where it has been applied, no matter how carefully it is applied to skin only and not on the fur itself. This goes away within a day or two though and the protection remains.
customer_reviews.author: TechGuyInBoston

customer_reviews.title: Saved the day
customer_reviews.text: Applied on my two big dogs on 9/5. By 9/6, no more fleas anywhere. Not on them, or in my house, or in my BED (which sucked, by the way). I've used this stuff before, a couple summers ago, and it kills them all within 12 hours in our experience. So glad I found an affordable 6 pack to get us through for three months.
customer_reviews.author: M. Allen

customer_reviews.title: Sorry, this does nothing and ayer will not help you out with it
customer_reviews.text: I put this on my dog and little to nothing happened. I called Bayer and they blew it off rudely since I was "obviously not using it correctly" I went to the vet and got Brevecto which works out to the same price or slightly cheaper and the effect was immediate and within 12 hours she was flea free and has not had any since. I live in Florida and we have the fleas
customer_reviews.author: Rick Grunwald

customer_reviews.title: It works!!
customer_reviews.text: I read reviews on every little thing down to cotton balls! Lol so I chose this based on majority of good reviews. I seriously was at my whits end with fleas, no matter what we bought along with treating the house, they would still come back. I have applied this to my dogs (2) roughly 3 weeks ago and they are finally gone for good. It worked extremely well, I will be buying this for any future!
customer_reviews.author: David Martin

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: Burned my dogs skin. And it attracted a tick that is now stuck in her neck. Worst product ever, I’m so disappointed after reading good reviews about it.
customer_reviews.author: Nathaly Rojas

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Same stuff sold at the veterinarian's office. We live in the country. Knock on wood, but our dog never gets ticks & we've never had flea issues. This is a liquid. Make sure to get the applicator directly on their skin. Make sure it is not where the dog can get to. Let it dry. Do not touch the area for a few days.
customer_reviews.author: D Johnston

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work on mild case of fleas
customer_reviews.text: Did not work for mild case of the fleas. Used 2 treatments on our dog and did nothing. I have to go to the vet now and have my dog be put on Revolution in addition to the cost of what I spent on this product. So irritated!
customer_reviews.author: Ryela Saleh

customer_reviews.title: Used to be a good product that worked
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure if they changed the formula or the ticks have built up resistance. I've been using this product for several years with great success but this season I've found numerous engorged ticks on my floor. Product is being applied as directed and my dogs are not in water so it should work as intended but sadly it isn't.
customer_reviews.author: Anderchuck

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work on ticks or fleas
customer_reviews.text: We were in California last year and my poor dog had so many ticks attached to him. I pulled off 16! I figured it was the pesticide resistant ticks in California. One year later we live in Michigan. He had several ticks this summer and is now infested with fleas! Now my indoor cats have fleas. Very frustrating that this medicine did not work.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia

customer_reviews.title: Does not work
customer_reviews.text: My dogs still had fleas after 2 applications. This never happened with other flea medications. Spent a lot of money on 2 packages and they are ineffective. Will not purchase again
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Not very easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This wasn't very easy to use. You have to do several spots on the back if the neck all the way down the back of the dog. I have a 1 yr old German Shepherd puppy and she doesn't like to sit still for anything. It was tough getting her to be still. I also found a tuck on her about 3 weeks later. Not sure it is working correctly.
customer_reviews.author: Dana M Brakhane

customer_reviews.title: DON’T BUY
customer_reviews.text: Id give it a 0, but there isn't one. Sad to say, our dog was dead the next day. PLEASE Be careful using this product. He started foaming at the mouth. 4 hours Later, Seizure and died.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin P Welsh

customer_reviews.title: Overall a good product; more recent application failed
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using this product as directed since I got it 6 months ago, and while it does seem to keep the ticks off my dog she is very itchy recently and I’ve pulled three fleas off her this past weekend. I wait more than a week between application and baths, so that’s not the problem. Maybe the one tube was faulty (I mean, I’ve been using this brand since March and the issue only just started since the last application), so I’m not marking it down as much as I would, but if it continues with the next application - which was supposed to be a week from now - I will throw away the rest of my pack.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Dolan

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: I have two dogs who love to roam outside in their free time. They and my home have suffered with flees for nearly 2 years. After using this one time, the fleas disappeared. Ive been using now for almost a year. My dogs skin and fur looks and feels much healthier, and they are happier they are no longer digging. I give them a bath and the next day apply the flea treatment once a month.
customer_reviews.author: Beck

customer_reviews.title: Does not work!
customer_reviews.text: This did absolutely nothing to kill fleas on my dogs! It was a waste of money. This sounds like I'm exaggerating but I honestly feel like my dogs have MORE fleas after being treated with this, if that's even possible!
customer_reviews.author: Valerie

customer_reviews.title: TERRIFIC PEST CONTROL FOR DOGS
customer_reviews.text: We had never had major issues with fleas or ticks on our dogs but we had used other brands of control fir them during peak season. This year early we begin to see fleas when the digs were in the yard. I found this on Amazon and it has been such a success. We haven't seen a flea since applying this.
customer_reviews.author: Peachee Keene

customer_reviews.title: The good: It works
customer_reviews.text: The good: It works. I switched to an oral preventative for a month and noticed two ticks for the first time around the four week mark. The bad: He absolutely hates it and runs away when it's time to put it on. For 4-5 days afterward, his back will twitch when you touch him there. Overall I would say to use it if your dog doesn't mind it, but the twitching is an indication to me that he is having a bad reaction to it.
customer_reviews.author: triplebeam1988

customer_reviews.title: Using this for over 8 years
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite topical for all my dogs past and present. Do not bathe 3 days prior and after applying. Do not pet them in the area you have applied. I have never had a problem with this not working. My dogs have never tested positive for heartworms, nor have they ever had fleas or ticks in their lives.
customer_reviews.author: Scelluet

customer_reviews.title: Price is a killer, but it works great
customer_reviews.text: This product has always worked for my dogs. The worst part about it is pressing that order button given the price of the product. Definitely a must buy product for controlling flea/tick problems. Combine this with using some of those canned foggers in your home and you will be golden.
customer_reviews.author: Oneeyebear

customer_reviews.title: One of the better spot on treatments
customer_reviews.text: Works really good for about 2 weeks, then seems to weaken. I usually get about 3 weeks before I have to re-apply. It is pretty costly and not last the whole month as advertised. I do live in a high flea area, so that may be some of the problem. I also like that it repels mosquitoes.
customer_reviews.author: Grandmama

customer_reviews.title: Works for flies!
customer_reviews.text: In addition to flea protection this topical prevents biting flies and other pests not controlled by other topicals. During the hot summer months flies can be an issue for my dogs, especially around the ears. These are not controlled by their heart worm medicine which does offer protection from fleas. Since adding this topical we have had no issues with flies and my girls are happy!
customer_reviews.author: Red

customer_reviews.title: no longer working for us
customer_reviews.text: Recently started a new package of this on my dogs, and it is not working against ticks. I applied it ten days ago and am now finding attached, engorged ticks. This always worked for us before, so I'm wondering if I got a bad batch or an expired batch? There doesn't appear to be any expiration date so I can check on that.
customer_reviews.author: New Hampshire Dog Mom

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: For some reason this didn’t really work on my sleeker German shepherd. After 2 weeks the deer ticks were not dying, but worked great in past. I had always bought from vet & will begin again . Same money pretty much. Makes me wonder where product on line is made & if the quality is different.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Bebout

customer_reviews.title: Dogs still scratching like crazy
customer_reviews.text: Since my two dogs were scratching still right after application I waited a week to see if maybe it takes awhile...still scratching like crazy ☹️
customer_reviews.author: dk

customer_reviews.title: Fleas having a party on my dog
customer_reviews.text: 2 weeks after putting Advantix 2 on my mini poodle, I trimmed her and pulled off 36 fleas. There is a reason there is no guarantee to get rid of fleas.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this deadly product! Not worth the risk.
customer_reviews.text: This product contains Permithrin which is so toxic that it nearly killed my pet and cost me $500 in Vet fees! I highly recommend this ingredient be removed, other flea medications don’t contain it as a necessity and work just fine. The Vet I went to won’t even bring this ingredient in her home. Not worth the risk. I feel the need to warn others and write the company. Toxic ingredients benefit no one and can be supplemented with better options.
customer_reviews.author: Robin

customer_reviews.title: Did not work for my dogs
customer_reviews.text: I bought this based on all the good reviews. I thought it was fairly expensive but that if it worked for so many other dogs then there was a good chance it would for mine. Well, it didn't. I put this on them after they dried off from their bath and the fleas never went away. I'll be trying another brand.
customer_reviews.author: spacejunky

customer_reviews.title: Fake Product??
customer_reviews.text: I have used this brand for 10 years and my dog has NEVER had fleas. Ordered from this company and for 2 months it has not worked at keeping the fleas off my dog. The only conclusion I can come to is that the product may not be the real thing.
customer_reviews.author: Linda D.

customer_reviews.title: Works good
customer_reviews.text: I have used this brand of tick and flea prevention for around 2 years now. We have an outside dog and cats and inside dog and cat and it works good both ways. I use to use several others that started ok but did not last long. This seems to work very well. Will continue to buy unless something changes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Causes sores on my dog
customer_reviews.text: This works great for keeping fleas and ticks off. I won't argue that. But twice I have found the spot where I applied this caused the skin to turn into a sore and become scabbed. I won't use the remaining doses.
customer_reviews.author: kris

customer_reviews.title: Not the best but definitely not the worst
customer_reviews.text: I have had a hard time lately finding a flea med to work for my dog. Used frontline for years and does not work like it used to. Gave this product a try. Not horrible I can say a definite improvement but not 100% satisfied. But will continue to use until I can find something better.
customer_reviews.author: Romy

customer_reviews.title: Finally something that works
customer_reviews.text: We used frontline plus for years on our dogs. For the most part it was pretty effective. Last year it just stopped working. After reading a ton of reviews and trying different treatments and collars with no success we took a chance with this one. Within a day I could tell a huge difference. A week and they were flea free with no signs of irritation.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Pontis

customer_reviews.title: Still no fleas 7 years and counting.
customer_reviews.text: No fleas in the house in many, many years. We have dogs on 3 sides of our backyard. Most of those dogs are outdoors most of the time. My dog spends days out in the yard, the rest of the time in the house. We also have a house cat (he never goes out). As long as I keep up on the Advantix, we do not have a flea problem. I never need to use anything on the cat or in the house. Dosing the dog with Advantix is enough all by itself. It works even if we take her camping for a week. Still no fleas 7 years and counting.
customer_reviews.author: Susan D

customer_reviews.title: My dog vomit for 3 days
customer_reviews.text: I got a female german Sheperd, 8years old. The next day after a bath I apply that product. As some other reviewers state there is something dangerously in that product. After a few hours, she starts behaving weirdly. She looks sleepy. The next day she vomits 4 times. The next day the same thing. On the third day, she vomits only twice. After 2 weeks after she still is slow and not as usual. BE AWARE!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Pewexonline

customer_reviews.title: Trusted brand!
customer_reviews.text: This is the only brand I trust 100%! I used to work at PetSmart and we recommended K9 Advantix to everyone. My dog really didn’t spend much time outside when we lived in apartments so I used a “bio(something)” brand and never had a problem. When we moved to our house we learned a deer frequents the area and we found a tick on her within a month so we switched to this 2 months ago and haven’t found another since! Note: I also treated the yard which may be helping the results.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Napierski

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product for all of my dogs and it didn’t kill any of the ticks. I still spent hours picking them off even after applying the treatment. I got my yard treated multiple times to help based on Bayers/pet controls recommendation. I still to this day find large female brown ticks on my dogs as if the treatment didn’t work.
customer_reviews.author: Zodinski

customer_reviews.title: Effective, but expensive
customer_reviews.text: We live in a wooded area with lots of deer and ticks are everywhere. We apply this every 3-4 weeks to our dogs and have no issues with ticks or fleas. We rarely find ticks on our dogs and if we do the ticks are usually already dead. Substance is very oily and you don't want to get it on your clothes or furniture. It can be a challenge to get it all through the dog's fur and onto their skin and some inevitable ends up matted to their fur. I would give 5 stars if it wasn't so freaking expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Flojos

customer_reviews.title: Every dog needs flea and tick prevention
customer_reviews.text: If you have temperatures above freezing, at any time during any month, you should be using some kind of flea and tick prevention in my opinion. For me that means all year round. This is an affordable option and it works well. My dog tolerates it well, she is a 70lb hound mix. I use one tube every month, and buying this two pack every two months with subscribe and save is a good choice for me.
customer_reviews.author: Rinny11

product_meta.title: K9 Advantix II Flea, Tick and Mosquito Prevention for X-Large Dogs, Over 55 lbs
product_meta.description:
Style:6 doses| Size:Over 55 lbThe 6-pack of Bayer K9 Advantix II flea and tick prevention for extra-large dogs is a broad-spectrum, veterinarian-recommended dog flea and tick prevention that also kills and repels mosquitoes, a benefit not found in many other flea and tick products. Some products require a flea or tick to bite your dog in order to work, but K9 Advantix II flea and tick prevention for dogs is a topical formula that works through contact, so your dog doesn’t have to endure a painful bite for the flea, tick or mosquito to die. Just one application of Bayer K9 Advantix II flea and tick prevention for extra-large dogs starts working to kill fleas within 12 hours, is waterproof after 24 hours, and continues to work to kill fleas, ticks and mosquitoes for up to 30 days, even after a bath or swimming. We recommend the use of a grooming shampoo designed specifically for pets. Do not use K9 Advantix II on cats. Use only on dogs.

BRAND STORY
By K9 Advantix
feature_bullets: 6 monthly applications of K9 Advantix II flea and tick prevention for extra-large dogs weighing 55 pounds or more
K9 Advantix II flea and tick prevention for dogs works through contact, so fleas, ticks and mosquitoes do not have to bite your dog to die
K9 Advantix II flea and tick control for dogs is an easy to apply topical formula
Starts working to kill fleas within 12 hours and keeps working for 30 days
Suitable for effective year-round dog flea and tick treatment for extra-large dogs

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
